title: Buying/Selling accounts
body:
Is this something that is looked down upon simply. Or is there a punishment to it? I'm not aware of the complications behind this issue.

I played a game today with a player named "", a Diamond tier player. Except that he wasn't. Someone bought the account and used it to play a game. He was very bm. I wouldn't have said anything if the guy didn't say he bought the account 40 games prior to our matchup. Which I think is kind of stupid myself, why admit to something like that lmao. 

But anyways, is there some kind of punishment?

replies.body:
Hey Incandecense,

Buying and selling accounts is against the ToS and can result in disciplinary action, including banned accounts.

Hey, I've got a question. I was wondering if for league of legends it is an issue for multiple people to use the same account. My friend was wondering if it would be ok to make a community account for his school. Is this against the ToS?
Sharing accounts is also against the ToS.

I' m no katey, but i suppose not.
Each account is treated related to its user, if that user swaps every time then it messes everything up.
This includes: matchmaking ( mostly for rankeds, but even for normals is annoying ), champions and skins bought and penalties due to behaviour.

Is that so hard to make an account for each user? Or you think unlocking the necessary champ for everyone is excessive ( and on that i give you reason, RITO PLZ ).
I would personally never share an account, too easy for some other person to get it banned.
